info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 26 at 1:38PM MST until April 27 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the second Wind Advisory, southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected.
* WHERE...Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County, Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County, and White Mountains.
* WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 7 PM MST /8 PM MDT/ this evening. For the second Wind Advisory, from 10 AM MST /11 AM MDT/ to 7 PM MST /8 PM MDT/ Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction:
Secure loose outdoor objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind.
Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles, such as RVs, campers, and tractor trailers. Use extra caution.

parameter.value: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MST /11 AM MDT/ TO 7 PM MST /8 PM MDT/ SUNDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST /8 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; White Mountains
